body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18871 (rpc: prevent circular deps by extracting into separate include by brakmic)
* #18857 (build: avoid repetitions when enabling warnings in configure.ac by vasild)
* #18843 (build: warn on potentially uninitialized reads by vasild)
* #18789 (qt: Add Create Unsigned button to SendConfirmationDialog by achow101)
* #18216 (test, build: Enable -Werror=sign-compare by Empact)
* #17908 (qt: Remove QFont warnings with QT_QPA_PLATFORM=minimal by hebasto)
* #16883 (WIP: Qt: add QML based mobile GUI by icota)
* #16116 (Avoid unnecessary signing provider copies on descriptor expansion by Empact)
* #15382 (util: add runCommandParseJSON by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK 6a8d284bf7595bd200cb27973a262c929cb72e14 -- diff looks correct

Thanks for making the change complete across the codebase.

I think we should consider building with `-Werror=suggest-override` by default. But that is perhaps out of the scope this PR :-)

Concept ACK.

> But that is perhaps out of the scope this

Why? Otherwise this may be necessary again right?

> > But that is perhaps out of the scope this
> 
> Why? Otherwise this may be necessary again right?

True! If @hebasto wants to incorporate `-Werror=suggest-override` as part of this PR I'm first in line to give a warm ACK :-)

@practicalswift @promag 
>> Why? Otherwise this may be necessary again right?
>
> True! If @hebasto wants to incorporate -Werror=suggest-override as part of this PR I'm first in line to give a warm ACK :-)

The latest push incorporates `-Wsuggest-override` as a compiler option.

PR description has been updated.
Fixed MSVC build.
Fixed protobuf stuff.
@practicalswift Would you mind re-reviewing this PR?
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Rebased.

Concept ACK.

Not convinced about `--enable-wleveldb`. Unless the warnings are purely silly, I think we should try to get these problems solved upstream not hide them.
(and if you really want to have a different warning level for built-in dependencies, maybe make it general and cover secp256k1 too?)

> I think we should consider building with -Werror=suggest-override by default. But that is perhaps out of the scope this PR :-)

NACK on WError of any kind by default. Feel free to enable it locally as a developer, but it is frustrating for packagers and people just trying to build the code, because changes in gcc version, dependency libraries and such frequently change the set of warnings.

> Not convinced about `--enable-wleveldb`.

It seems there is a commit https://github.com/google/leveldb/commit/28e6d238be73e743c963fc0a26395b783a7565e2 to upstream related to `-Wsuggest-override`.

> Unless the warnings are purely silly, I think we should try to get these problems solved upstream not hide them.

E.g., #15539.

> It seems there is a commit google/leveldb@28e6d23 to upstream related to -Wsuggest-override.

Nice, let's pull that in. It might be time to do a leveldb update from upstream anyhow for 0.20.

> E.g., #15539.

Yes, would agree those are silly. I guess we could disable specific warnings for leveldb, if there's no change of them being solved, I just dislike the idea of a blanket disable.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Rebased.

ACK 46047bc4e2bb9063e35fb56b17236eead4052ea8 -- diff looks correct

Thanks for keeping this PR rebased!
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase

Rebased and dropped a commit from #16722; see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16722#issuecomment-584111086.

There are 3 warnings from the `src/leveldb` subtree only:
```
$ gcc --version | grep gcc
gcc (Ubuntu 7.4.0-1ubuntu1~18.04.1) 7.4.0
$ ./autogen.sh
$ ./configure
$ make -j 4 > /dev/null
/usr/bin/ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
leveldb/db/c.cc: In function âleveldb_filterpolicy_t* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)â:
leveldb/db/c.cc:474:17: warning: âvirtual const char* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::Name() constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     const char* Name() const { return rep_->Name(); }
                 ^~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:475:10: warning: âvirtual void leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::CreateFilter(const leveldb::Slice*, int, std::__cxx11::string*) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     void CreateFilter(const Slice* keys, int n, std::string* dst) const {
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:478:10: warning: âvirtual bool leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::KeyMayMatch(const leveldb::Slice&, const leveldb::Slice&) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     bool KeyMayMatch(const Slice& key, const Slice& filter) const {
          ^~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/bin/ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
```
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Rebased after #18034 has been merged.
ACK ec530398dbb3138d26c4783f880e4efe439fc450 -- looks good: let's get this merged :)
Code Review ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16710/commits/ec530398dbb3138d26c4783f880e4efe439fc450 - also confirmed moves out of Q_SLOTS were appropriate.
This is final, but not virtual, so override is already implied. I am not sure why the compiler warns here?!

GCC (Debian 8.3.0-6) will warn about this:
```bash
  CXX      script/libbitcoin_common_a-descriptor.o
script/descriptor.cpp:517:10: warning: 'virtual bool {anonymous}::AddressDescriptor::IsSolvable() const' can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     bool IsSolvable() const final { return false; }
          ^~~~~~~~~~
```

However `clang-tidy` with [modernize-use-override](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-use-override.html) will tell you that it, along with a bunch of the other overrides added here are redundant:
```bash
src/script/descriptor.cpp:378:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool IsRange() const override final
         ^               ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:414:17: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    std::string ToString() const override final
                ^                ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:421:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool ToPrivateString(const SigningProvider& arg, std::string& out) const override final
         ^                                                                   ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:480:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool Expand(int pos, const SigningProvider& provider, std::vector<CScript>& output_scripts, FlatSigningProvider& out, std::vector<unsigned char>* cache = nullptr) const override final
         ^                                                                                                                                                                   ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:485:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool ExpandFromCache(int pos, const std::vector<unsigned char>& cache, std::vector<CScript>& output_scripts, FlatSigningProvider& out) const override final
         ^                                                                                                                                       ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:491:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    void ExpandPrivate(int pos, const SigningProvider& provider, FlatSigningProvider& out) const override final
         ^                                                                                       ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:517:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool IsSolvable() const override final { return false; }
         ^                  ~~~~~~~~~
src/script/descriptor.cpp:542:10: warning: 'override' is redundant since the function is already declared 'final' [modernize-use-override]
    bool IsSolvable() const override final { return false; }
         ^                  ~~~~~~~~~
```

> This is final, but not virtual, so override is already implied. I am not sure why the compiler warns here?!

This GCC behavior fixed for 9.2 ([GCC Bugzilla â Bug 78010](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=78010)).

> However `clang-tidy` with [modernize-use-override](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-use-override.html) will tell you that it, along with a bunch of the other overrides added here are redundant:

There is an [`AllowOverrideAndFinal`](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-use-override.html#cmdoption-arg-allowoverrideandfinal) option:
> If set to non-zero, this check will not diagnose `override` as redundant with `final`. This is useful when code will be compiled by a compiler with warning/error checking flags requiring `override` explicitly on overridden members, such as `gcc -Wsuggest-override`/`gcc -Werror=suggest-override`. Default is _0_.
I am fine with the `src/qt` changes, but I am not sure if it make sense to "enforce" this with a warning that spits out misleading information on older and buggy compilers.

It may make sense to use a bunch of test-cases to test whether or not we should enable this, and include those cases that are known to cause issues with buggy compilers. Then just say "if your compiler can't handle all test-cases correctly, we'll just turn the warnings off wholesale".

IIRC the c++xy m4 test macro takes a similar approach.

Updated ec530398dbb3138d26c4783f880e4efe439fc450 -> f33cc5446b3d8358fa274cfee0287b30f82ceaab ([pr16710.10](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr16710.10) -> [pr16710.11](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr16710.11), [compare](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr16710.10..pr16710.11)):

- removed ignoring of GCC "-Wsuggest-override" diagnostic for `leveldb/env.h` header as it is fixed in #17398 
- added ignoring of GCC "-Wsuggest-override" diagnostic for `db_cxx.h` header as it causes spammy warnings on Fedora 31 (GCC 9.2.1, `libdb4-cxx-devel.x86_64`::4.8.30-30.fc31)
- addressed [comments](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16710#discussion_r386139557) about final overriding functions

---

**GCC 7.4.0** output:
```
$ gcc --version | head -1
gcc (Ubuntu 7.4.0-1ubuntu1~18.04.1) 7.4.0
$ make > /dev/null
/usr/bin/ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
leveldb/db/c.cc: In function âleveldb_filterpolicy_t* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)â:
leveldb/db/c.cc:474:17: warning: âvirtual const char* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::Name() constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     const char* Name() const { return rep_->Name(); }
                 ^~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:475:10: warning: âvirtual void leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::CreateFilter(const leveldb::Slice*, int, std::__cxx11::string*) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     void CreateFilter(const Slice* keys, int n, std::string* dst) const {
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:478:10: warning: âvirtual bool leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::KeyMayMatch(const leveldb::Slice&, const leveldb::Slice&) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
     bool KeyMayMatch(const Slice& key, const Slice& filter) const {
          ^~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/bin/ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
```

---


**GCC 9.2.1** output:
```
$ gcc --version | head -1
gcc (GCC) 9.2.1 20190827 (Red Hat 9.2.1-1)
$ qmake-qt5 -v | grep Qt
Using Qt version 5.13.2 in /usr/lib64
$ make > /dev/null 
In file included from /usr/include/string.h:495,
                 from ./serialize.h:19,
                 from ./netaddress.h:13,
                 from ./protocol.h:13,
                 from protocol.cpp:6:
In function âchar* strncpy(char*, const char*, size_t)â,
    inlined from âCMessageHeader::CMessageHeader(const unsigned char (&)[4], const char*, unsigned int)â at protocol.cpp:89:12:
/usr/include/bits/string_fortified.h:106:34: warning: âchar* __builtin_strncpy(char*, const char*, long unsigned int)â specified bound 12 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  106 |   return __builtin___strncpy_chk (__dest, __src, __len, __bos (__dest));
      |          ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc: In function âleveldb_filterpolicy_t* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)â:
leveldb/db/c.cc:474:17: warning: âvirtual const char* leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::Name() constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
  474 |     const char* Name() const { return rep_->Name(); }
      |                 ^~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:475:10: warning: âvirtual void leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::CreateFilter(const leveldb::Slice*, int, std::string*) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
  475 |     void CreateFilter(const Slice* keys, int n, std::string* dst) const {
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
leveldb/db/c.cc:478:10: warning: âvirtual bool leveldb_filterpolicy_create_bloom(int)::Wrapper::KeyMayMatch(const leveldb::Slice&, const leveldb::Slice&) constâ can be marked override [-Wsuggest-override]
  478 |     bool KeyMayMatch(const Slice& key, const Slice& filter) const {
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~
interfaces/chain.cpp: In member function âvirtual std::unique_ptr<interfaces::Chain::Lock> interfaces::{anonymous}::ChainImpl::lock(bool)â:
interfaces/chain.cpp:250:25: warning: redundant move in return statement [-Wredundant-move]
  250 |         return std::move(result);
      |                ~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~
interfaces/chain.cpp:250:25: note: remove âstd::moveâ call

```

@theuni 
> It may make sense to use a bunch of test-cases to test whether or not we should enable this, and include those cases that are known to cause issues with buggy compilers. Then just say "if your compiler can't handle all test-cases correctly, we'll just turn the warnings off wholesale".
> 
> IIRC the c++xy m4 test macro takes a similar approach.

Yes, m4 macro could test if `-Wsuggest-override` is buggy for a particular GCC which is used for compiling.

But it seems overkill to "turn the warnings off wholesale". Especially considering that "buggy" GCC just fires some false-positive warnings, which could be easily suppressed in well-documented manner.
ACK f33cc5446b3d8358fa274cfee0287b30f82ceaab

> But it seems overkill to "turn the warnings off wholesale". Especially considering that "buggy" GCC just fires some false-positive warnings, which could be easily suppressed in well-documented manner.

If a warning flag is known to be buggy and it can be detected, we should turn it off. It's perfectly reasonable imo to say "If override warnings for this compiler are known to be broken, don't enable them".

Updated f33cc5446b3d8358fa274cfee0287b30f82ceaab -> d09c985ac4c7289875529da68f4a0ed1f04361f6 ([pr16710.11](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr16710.11) -> [pr16710.12](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr16710.12), [compare](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr16710.11..pr16710.12)):

- fixed MSVC build

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fa733bbd78add587e19f0175ab9c127a8c27e024/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Rebased due to the conflict with #18204.
ACK 2e9e8c8122c3c837e61f8b8b703a7807762ee550 -- patch looks correct

ACK 2e9e8c812, compiles with Clang 11.0.0.

The more `-W...` the better :)

To clarify: Clang does not support the newly added flag, so there we properly don't add it. It also compiles with gcc 9.3.0 where `-Wsuggest-override` is detected and used.
Reviewers of this PR might be interested in reviewing #17895 which enables Clang's `-Wconditional-uninitialized` (warn on potential uninitialized reads).

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Rebased due to the conflict with #18843.

What do you think about splitting out the gui changes from the build system changes? They are the bulk of the changes, but the easiest to review. Mostly move-only + adding the override, whereas the other changes are refactoring walletdb and changing the build stystem.
